> Expanded Solutions  
> 1. \\(\log_2{8}\Small{=1\cdot\log_2{2^3}=1\cdot3\log_2{2}=3}\\log_8{2}\Small{=1\cdot\log_8{8^{1/3}}=1\cdot1/3\cdot\log_8{8}=1/3}\\ a\￠b \Small{=\left(\log_{b}{a}\right)/\left(\log_{a}{b}\right)=\frac{\log_8{2}}{\log_2{8}}=\frac{1/3}{3}=\fbox{\dfrac{1}{9}}}\\)
> 2. Let's rename \[\log_{9}{4}+\log_{4}{9}\] as \\(a\). Then, we have \[3/2=\log_{9}{4/2}+\log_{4}{9/4}=\log_{9}{2}+\log_{4}{2}=a.\] Since it's circulation of base, \[\log_{9}{2}*\log_{4}{2}=1\], so we have \[\left(\log_{9}{2}+\log_{4}{2}\right)^2=\left(\log_{9}{2}\right)^2+2\left(\log_{9}{2}\right)\left(\log_{4}{2}\right)+\left(\log_{4}{2}\right)^2=5/4\\ 4*1+6\left(\log_{9}{2}\right)+4*1=5/4\\ 28/4=5/4\]. From here we get \[\fbox{\left(\log_{9}{2}\right)^2+\left(\log_{4}{2}\right)^2=1/4}.\] Next, we calculate \[\left(\log_{9}{2}-\log_{4}{2}\right)^2=\left(\log_{9}{2}\right)^2-\left(\log_{4}{2}\right)^2+2*\left(\log_{9}{2}\right)*\left(\log_{4}{2}\right)\cdot[-1]=1/4-1/2=-1/4\]

### Question:
f(x)=1,x,x^2,g are three times differentiable functions. If f''''(2)=6,f''''(3)=5,g(2)=f(2), prove that the relationship between the two functions satisfies the operation rule!.
Please provide your answer in LaTeX format.
Wrap your answer in a pair of double square brackets, just like this: [[your answer]].

### Answer:
[[\text{ According to the definition of the custom operation, }f\bigtriangleup g=(f(g(x)))', there are:
$$f\bigtriangleup g=f'(g(x))\cdot g'(x)=f'(g(x))\cdot \frac{g(x+1)-g(x-1)}{2}$$
$$f\bigtriangleup g(f(x))=f''(x)\cdot \frac{g(x+1)-g(x-1)}{2}$$
$$f\bigtriangleup g(f''(x))\cdot \frac{g(x+1)-g(x-1)}{2}=f'''(x)\cdot \frac{g(x+1)-g(x-1)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(x)}{2}$$
$$f\bigtriangleup g(f'''(x))\cdot \frac{g(x+1)-g(x-1)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(x)}{2}=f''''(x)\cdot \frac{g(x+1)-g(x-1)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(x)}{2}\cdot \frac{g'''(x)}{2}$$
Since $g(2)=f(2), g(2)=1$, we can get the following two inequalities,
\begin{cases}
f \bigtriangleup g(1)\cdot \frac{g(2)-g(0)}{2}&{\textstyle <}f \bigtriangleup g(1)\cdot \frac{3}{2} \\
f \bigtriangleup g(f''(2))\cdot \frac{g(2)-g(0)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(2)}{2}&{\textstyle>}f \bigtriangleup g(f''(2))\cdot \frac{1}{4} \\
\end{cases}
Since $f=1\&x\&x^2$, $f(2)=6$, so we have
$$f'(2)=3, \\
f''(2)=2, \\
f'''(2)=0, \\
f''''(2)=6.$$
Then we get the following set of inequalities:
\begin{cases}
f \bigtriangleup g(1)\cdot \frac{g(2)-g(0)}{2}&{\textstyle <}f \bigtriangleup g(1)\cdot \frac{3}{2}=\frac{3}{2} \\
f \bigtriangleup g(f''(2))\cdot \frac{g(2)-g(0)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(2)}{2}&{\textstyle>}f \bigtriangleup g(f''(2))\cdot \frac{1}{4}=2 \\
f \bigtriangleup g(f'''(2))\cdot \frac{g(2)-g(0)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(2)}{2}\cdot \frac{g'''(2)}{2}&{\textstyle>}f \bigtriangleup g(f'''(2))\cdot \frac{1}{8}=0 \\
f \bigtriangleup g(f''''(2))\cdot \frac{g(2)-g(0)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(2)}{2}\cdot \frac{g'''(2)}{2}&{\textstyle>}f \bigtriangleup g(f''''(2))\cdot \frac{1}{8}=6 \\
\end{cases}
Since $f''''(2)=6$, we have
$$f\Dot\bigtriangleup g=f'''(x)\cdot \frac{g(x+1)-g(x-1)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(x)}{2}\cdot \frac{g'''(x)}{2}\textgreater f''(x)\cdot \frac{g(2)-g(0)}{2}\cdot \frac{g''(2)}{2}\textgreater 2.$$
And since $6\textgreater 5$, we know that the relationship prove the operation rule.]]
